title: How np.array([]) works in numpy
body_html:
my sample code :

a = 2.0
b = 3.0
x = np.array([a, b])
print x

Output : [ 2. 3.]

I just wanted to know , how this array is created here. Basically how np.array works ? Which constructor/function is invoking to generate this array ?

I tried putting prints in /numpy/numpy/lib/user_array.py but that didn't help.
body_text:
my sample code :
a = 2.0
b = 3.0
x = np.array([a, b])
print x

Output :  [ 2.  3.]
I just wanted to know , how this array is created here.  Basically how np.array works ?  Which constructor/function is invoking to generate this array ?
I tried putting prints in /numpy/numpy/lib/user_array.py but that didn't help.
body:
my sample code :

```
a = 2.0
b = 3.0
x = np.array([a, b])
print x
```

Output : ` [ 2.  3.]`

I just wanted to know , how this array is created here.  Basically how np.array works ?  Which constructor/function is invoking to generate this array ?

I tried putting prints in `/numpy/numpy/lib/user_array.py` but that didn't help.
